description:
Hormones are substances that are made by the body and are sent directly out into the
      bloodstream to increase or decrease the function of certain organs, glands, or other
      hormones.  Testosterone is a hormone found in the blood of all girls, but some girls have
      too much testosterone in their blood. Too much testosterone in the blood can possibly lead
      to a problem called polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). People with PCOS have abnormal
      menstrual periods, excess facial and body hair, and too much testosterone in their blood. On
      the other hand, some girls with too much testosterone in their blood do not develop PCOS. We
      do not know why some of these girls develop PCOS and why some do not.

      The purpose of this research study is to find out whether too much testosterone can cause
      problems with other hormones that can lead to the development of PCOS. This study may help
      us understand more about the causes of PCOS.
title: Assessment of Day-night Secretion of Progesterone and LH Across Pubertal Maturation in Girls With and Without Hyperandrogenemia
